content:
node

nodenode encodes a node, a possibly labeled point in a graph. [19.1 Graphs and Digraphs ]
Modulenets â€” Graphs, networks, and trees
Attributes
  • att.global ( @xml:id , @n , @xml:lang , @xml:base , @xml:space ) (att.global.rendition ( @rend , @style , @rendition ) ) (att.global.linking ( @corresp , @synch , @sameAs , @copyOf , @next , @prev , @exclude , @select ) ) (att.global.analytic ( @ana ) ) (att.global.facs ( @facs ) ) (att.global.change ( @change ) ) (att.global.responsibility ( @cert , @resp ) ) (att.global.source ( @source ) )
  • att.typed (@type, @subtype )
    • @value
    provides the value of a node, which is a feature structure or other analytic element.
    Usage
    opt
    Datatype
    teidata.pointer
    @type
    provides a type for a node.
    Usage
    opt
    Datatype
    teidata.enumerated
    <graph> <node xml:id="gnex11" adjTo="#gnex12" adj="#gnex13" type="initial"> <label>1</label> </node> <node xml:id="gnex12" adjFrom="#gnex11" adjTo="#gnex13"> <label>2</label> </node> <node xml:id="gnex13" adjFrom="#gnex12" adj="#gnex11" type="final"> <label>3</label> </node> </graph>
    bibliography
    @adjTo
    gives the identifiers of the nodes which are adjacent to the current node.
    Usage
    opt
    Datatype
    teidata.pointer
    <graph> <node xml:id="gnex21" adjTo="#gnex22" adj="#gnex23" type="initial"> <label>1</label> </node> <node xml:id="gnex22" adjTo="#gnex23"> <label>2</label> </node> <node xml:id="gnex23" type="final"> <label>3</label> </node> </graph>
    bibliography
    @adjFrom
    gives the identifiers of the nodes which are adjacent from the current node.
    Usage
    opt
    Datatype
    teidata.pointer
    <graph> <node xml:id="gnex31" type="initial"> <label>1</label> </node> <node xml:id="gnex32" adjFrom="#gnex31"> <label>2</label> </node> <node xml:id="gnex33" adjFrom="#gnex32" adj="#gnex31" type="final"> <label>3</label> </node> </graph>
    bibliography
    @adj
    gives the identifiers of the nodes which are both adjacent to and adjacent from the current node.
    Usage
    opt
    Datatype
    teidata.pointer
    <graph> <node xml:id="gnex41" adj="#gnex42 #gnex43" type="initial"> <label>1</label> </node> <node xml:id="gnex42" adj="#gnex41 #gnex43"> <label>2</label> </node> <node xml:id="gnex43" adj="#gnex42 #gnex41" type="final"> <label>3</label> </node> </graph>
    bibliography
    @inDegree
    gives the in degree of the node, the number of nodes which are adjacent from the given node.
    Usage
    opt
    Datatype
    teidata.count
    <graph> <node xml:id="gnex51" adjTo="#gnex52" adj="#gnex53" inDegree="1" type="initial"> <label>1</label> </node> <node xml:id="gnex52" adjFrom="#gnex51" adjTo="#gnex53" inDegree="2"> <label>2</label> </node> <node xml:id="gnex53" adjFrom="#gnex52" adj="#gnex51" inDegree="2" type="final"> <label>3</label> </node> </graph>
    bibliography
    @outDegree
    gives the out degree of the node, the number of nodes which are adjacent to the given node.
    Usage
    opt
    Datatype
    teidata.count
    <graph> <node xml:id="gnex61" adjTo="#gnex62" adj="#gnex63" outDegree="2" type="initial"> <label>1</label> </node> <node xml:id="gnex62" adjFrom="#gnex61" adjTo="#gnex63" outDegree="1"> <label>2</label> </node> <node xml:id="gnex63" adjFrom="#gnex62" adj="#gnex61" outDegree="2" type="final"> <label>3</label> </node> </graph>
    bibliography
    @degree
    gives the degree of the node, the number of arcs with which the node is incident.
    Usage
    opt
    Datatype
    teidata.count
    <graph> <node xml:id="gnex71" adjTo="#gnex72" adj="#gnex73" outDegree="1" inDegree="0" degree="1" type="initial"> <label>1</label> </node> <node xml:id="gnex72" adjFrom="#gnex71" adjTo="#gnex73" outDegree="1" inDegree="1" degree="0"> <label>2</label> </node> <node xml:id="gnex73" adjFrom="#gnex72" adj="#gnex71" outDegree="0" inDegree="1" degree="1" type="final"> <label>3</label> </node> </graph>
    bibliography
    Contained by

    nets

    :
    • graph
    May contain

    core

    :
    • label
    Note

    Zero, one, or two children label elements may be present. The first occurence of label provides a label for the arc; the second provides a second label for the arc, and should be used if a transducer is being encoded whose actions are associated with nodes rather than with arcs.

    Example
    <node xml:id="t6" type="final" inDegree="2" outDegree="0"> <label>6</label> </node>
    bibliography
    Content model<content> <sequence minOccurs="0"> <elementRef key="label"/> <elementRef key="label" minOccurs="0"/> </sequence> </content>
